title: Level 8 Space Practice Test
description: Test your understanding of congruence, similarity, angle relationships with parallel lines, and coordinate geometry.

questions.question: Two parallel lines are cut by a transversal. If one angle is $55°$, what is the corresponding angle?
questions.explanation: Corresponding angles are equal when formed by parallel lines and a transversal. So the corresponding angle is also $55°$.

questions.question: Which congruence condition requires a right angle, the hypotenuse, and one other side?
questions.explanation: RHS stands for Right angle-Hypotenuse-Side. It's a special congruence condition that applies only to right-angled triangles.

questions.question: Two parallel lines are cut by a transversal. If a co-interior angle is $130°$, what is the other co-interior angle?
questions.explanation: Co-interior angles are supplementary, meaning they add to $180°$. So the other angle $= 180° - 130° = 50°$.

questions.question: Triangles PQR and XYZ are similar with a scale factor of 3. If $PQ = 4$ cm, what is $XY$?
questions.explanation: In similar figures, corresponding sides are in the same ratio. $XY = PQ \times 3 = 4 \times 3 = 12$ cm.

questions.question: In which quadrant of the Cartesian plane does the point $(-3, 5)$ lie?
questions.explanation: Quadrant 2 has negative $x$ and positive $y$ values. Since $(-3, 5)$ has $x = -3$ (negative) and $y = 5$ (positive), it lies in Quadrant 2.

questions.question: Triangles ABC and DEF have $AB = DE$, $\angle A = \angle D$, and $AC = DF$. Which congruence condition is satisfied?
questions.explanation: We have two sides ($AB = DE$ and $AC = DF$) and the included angle ($\angle A = \angle D$) between them. This is SAS (Side-Angle-Side).

questions.question: Two parallel lines are cut by a transversal creating an alternate angle of $74°$. What is the alternate angle on the other side?
questions.explanation: Alternate angles are equal when lines are parallel. So the alternate angle is also $74°$.

questions.question: Find the midpoint of the line segment joining $(2, 6)$ and $(8, 10)$. Write your answer as coordinates, e.g., (x, y).
Two similar triangles have corresponding sides in the ratio $2:5$. If the shorter side of the larger triangle is 15 cm, what is the corresponding side of the smaller triangle?
questions.explanation: The ratio is $2:5$, so $\frac{\text{small}}{\text{large}} = \frac{2}{5}$. The corresponding side of the smaller triangle $= 15 \times \frac{2}{5} = 6$ cm.

questions.question: Angles on a straight line add to how many degrees?
questions.explanation: Angles on a straight line are supplementary, meaning they add to $180°$.
